io.apptik.comm.jus

Class Request<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.apptik.comm.jus.Request<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of parsed response this request expects.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Request<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StringRequest

    public class Request<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Request<T>>, java.lang.Cloneable
    Base class for all network requests.
    This class can be used directly for all standard requests. Use setNetworkRequest(NetworkRequest) to provide the http entity to be sent. For complex requests you can use MultipartBuilder and FormEncodingBuilder to generate the setNetworkRequest(NetworkRequest)
    Use Converter or Converter.Factory to transform data to NetworkRequest and Response from NetworkResponse.

    If more complex logic is required and request is extended then one should implement: getBody() in case of Post or Put getHeadersMap() in case of specific headers getBodyContentType() in case of specific content type Note that if != null it will be added to the headers of the request

      Supported request methods.

      protected java.lang.Integer sequence
      Sequence number of this request, used to enforce FIFO ordering.

      • EVENT_CANCELED_AT_DELIVERY

        public static final java.lang.String EVENT_CANCELED_AT_DELIVERY
        when response is prepared for delivery but is the request is already cancelled so that response will be ignored and Request#onResponse or Request#onError will not be called. Also the request will be finalized.

        Although no response callback will be sent the Request response from getRawResponse() should available if needed for logging purposes for example.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final java.lang.String EVENT_DONE

        public static final java.lang.String EVENT_NOT_MODIFIED

      • Request

        public Request(java.lang.String method,
               HttpUrl url,
               Converter<NetworkResponse,T> converterFromResponse)
        Creates a new request with the given method (one of the values from Request.Method), URL, and error listener. Note that the normal response listener is not provided here as delivery of responses is provided by subclasses, who have a better idea of how to deliver an already-parsed response.

        public java.lang.String getCacheKey()
        Returns the cache key for this request. By default, this is the URL.

      • setCacheEntry

        public <R extends Request<T>> R setCacheEntry(Cache.Entry entry)
        Annotates this request with an entry retrieved for it from cache. Used for cache coherency support.
        Returns:
        This Request object to allow for chaining.

      • getCacheEntry

        public Cache.Entry getCacheEntry()
        Returns the annotated cache entry, or null if there isn't one.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Mark this request as canceled. No callback will be delivered.

      • isCanceled

        public boolean isCanceled()
        Returns true if this request has been canceled.

      • getHeadersMap

        public final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getHeadersMap()
        Returns a list of extra HTTP headers to go along with this request

      • getHeaders

        public final Headers getHeaders()

      • getBodyContentType

        public java.lang.String getBodyContentType()
        Returns the content type of the POST or PUT body.

      • getBody

        public byte[] getBody()
        Returns the raw POST or PUT body to be sent.

      • setShouldCache

        public final <R extends Request<T>> R setShouldCache(boolean shouldCache)
        Set whether or not responses to this request should be cached.
        Returns:
        This Request object to allow for chaining.

      • shouldCache

        public final boolean shouldCache()
        Returns true if responses to this request should be cached.

      • hasHadResponseDelivered

        public boolean hasHadResponseDelivered()
        Returns true if this request has had a response delivered for it. this is useful in case cache is returned and the new response is "not modified"

      • parseNetworkResponse

        protected Response<T> parseNetworkResponse(NetworkResponse response)
        Subclasses can implement this to parse the raw network response and return an appropriate response type. This method will be called from a worker threadId. The response will not be delivered if you return null.
        Parameters:
        response - Response from the network
        Returns:
        The parsed response, or null in the case of an error

      • parseNetworkError

        protected JusError parseNetworkError(JusError jusError)
        Subclasses can override this method to parse 'networkError' and return a more specific error.

        The default implementation just returns the passed 'networkError'.

        Parameters:
        jusError - the error retrieved from the network
        Returns:
        an NetworkError augmented with additional information

      • deliverResponse

        protected void deliverResponse(T response)
        Subclasses must implement this to perform delivery of the parsed response to their listeners. The given response is guaranteed to be non-null; responses that fail to parse are not delivered.
        Parameters:
        response - The parsed response returned by parseNetworkResponse(NetworkResponse)

      • deliverError

        public void deliverError(JusError error)
        Delivers error message to the ErrorListener that the Request was initialized with.
        Parameters:
        error - Error details

      • getFuture

        public RequestFuture<T> getFuture()

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Request<T> other)
        Our comparator sorts from high to low priority, and secondarily by sequence number to provide FIFO ordering.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Request<T>>

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
